skill.name: homeassistant-config
skill.description: Create and manage Home Assistant YAML configuration files including automations, scripts, templates, blueprints, Lovelace dashboards, and file organization. Use when working with Home Assistant configuration files (.yaml, .yml) or discussing HA automations, scripts, sensors, or dashboards.
skill.summary: Create and manage Home Assistant YAML configuration files including automations, scripts, templates,...
skill.author: ESJavadex

security_audit.summary: This skill provides Home Assistant YAML configuration guidance and validation scripts. The only risk factor is filesystem access for YAML validation, which is necessary for its stated purpose. No network calls, external commands, credential access, or malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Create Home Assistant automations and dashboards
content.value_statement: Home Assistant configuration files require precise YAML syntax and proper structure. This skill provides validation tools, example configurations, and best practices for automations, scripts, templates, blueprints, and Lovelace dashboards.
actual_capabilities: Validate YAML syntax and Home Assistant structure
Build Lovelace dashboards with cards and views
limitations: Does not execute or deploy configurations to Home Assistant
Does not access Home Assistant API or entity states
Does not validate runtime integration compatibility
Scripts require Python and PyYAML installed

use_cases.title: Create first automation
use_cases.description: Set up motion-activated lights with proper YAML structure and syntax

use_cases.title: Build complex dashboards
use_cases.description: Design Lovelace dashboards with custom cards, conditional displays, and responsive layouts

use_cases.title: Optimize configuration
use_cases.description: Find duplicate automations, refactor scripts, and implement blueprints for reusability

prompt_templates.title: Basic automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an automation that turns on the living room light when motion is detected after sunset, with a 5-minute delay before turning off

prompt_templates.title: Template sensor
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a template sensor that calculates the total power usage from multiple smart plugs and shows daily energy cost

prompt_templates.title: Lovelace dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Mushroom cards configuration for the living room that shows temperature, humidity, and light controls in a compact layout

prompt_templates.title: Blueprint creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a blueprint for motion-activated lighting with configurable motion sensor, target light, wait time, and day/night brightness settings

output_examples.input: Create an automation that turns on hallway lights when motion is detected between sunset and sunrise
output: description: 'Turn on hallway lights when motion is detected at night'

best_practices: Always use 2 spaces for indentation, never tabs
Use plural form for triggers, conditions, and actions
Add unique IDs to automations for UI editing support
anti_patterns: Using tabs instead of spaces in YAML files
Unquoted strings that look like booleans
Hardcoding entity IDs instead of using variables

faq.question: What versions of Home Assistant are supported?
faq.answer: This skill uses 2024+ syntax with modern trigger, condition, and action formats. Most patterns work with 2022.4+.

faq.question: What are the validation script requirements?
faq.answer: Scripts require Python 3 and PyYAML installed. Run pip install pyyaml before using validation tools.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing Home Assistant?
faq.answer: This skill generates configuration files. You must manually copy or deploy files to your Home Assistant instance.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts only read files for validation. No data is sent externally or stored beyond the session.

faq.question: Why does the skill need filesystem access?
faq.answer: File access is required to validate YAML syntax, check for duplicates, and analyze configuration structure.

faq.question: How does this compare to Home Assistant Studio?
faq.answer: This skill provides Claude Code integration for generating and validating configurations. Studio is a web-based editor.
